title: How to Add, Edit, or Delete Your Uber Payment Methods

steps.title: Tap on Account and select Wallet.
steps.content: Tap on Account and select Wallet . Open the Uber app, and click on the Account option listed at the bottom right of the screen. Then, click on the Wallet icon near the top of the screen to view all of the payment methods attached to your account. When you use the Uber website, click on your profile picture in the top right corner and select “Wallet” from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Select the payment method you want to update and click Edit.
steps.content: Select the payment method you want to update and click Edit . From there, you can edit the expiration date, CVV number, and billing zip code. When you’re finished, tap on “Save” to stop editing your card info. You are not able to edit a credit or debit card number after you enter it. If you want to use a different card, you must add it as a separate payment method.

steps.title: Select Account and tap on Wallet.
steps.content: Select Account and tap on Wallet . When you open the Uber app, tap the Account icon at the bottom right of the screen, and then pick Wallet from the top middle of the menu. [1] X Research source On the Uber website, log in, click on your profile in the top right corner, and choose “Wallet” from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Add payment method.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Add payment method . This allows you to enter a credit card or log in to a different payment method, like Apple Pay, Venmo, and more.

steps.title: Scan or manually enter your credit or debit card.
steps.content: Scan or manually enter your credit or debit card. Tap on the camera icon and take a picture of your card so the information is visible. Then, enter the expiration date, CVV, and billing ZIP when you’re prompted. If you’re not able to scan the card with your camera, then type the card number into the text box instead.

steps.title: Log in to an alternative payment method.
steps.content: Log in to an alternative payment method. If you want to use Venmo, PayPal, Uber gift cards, or a different way to pay for your ride, select it from the list of available payment options. The app may open a browser window so you can log in and link the payment method to Uber.

steps.title: Open your Account settings and click Wallet.
steps.content: Open your Account settings and click Wallet . Log in to the Uber app, and select Account from the menu on the bottom of the screen. Then, tap on “Wallet” in the top middle to access all of your payment info. [2] X Research source If you’re using the Uber website, then click on your profile picture in the top right corner and select “Wallet” from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Tap on the payment method and select Remove payment method.
steps.content: Tap on the payment method and select Remove payment method . Scroll until you find the card or payment method that you want to get rid of. Select the payment method and click on the “Remove” option to delete it from your account. You’re required to have at least 1 payment method linked to your Uber account. If you only have a single payment method, then you must add a second method before deleting the old one.

steps.title: Tap on your payment method and choose a new one before you order.
steps.content: Tap on your payment method and choose a new one before you order. After you request a ride on Uber and enter the address, look for your payment information near the bottom of the screen. Select the current payment method to open your Uber Wallet and select a different one for your trip.

steps.title: Select Switch from the ride panel.
steps.content: Select Switch from the ride panel. While you’re riding, open the Uber app and click on the white panel at the bottom of your screen. Look for the “Switch” option next to the ride’s price, and tap on it. Choose the payment method that you want to use instead for your ride. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Help menu from your Account page.
steps.content: Open the Help menu from your Account page. Click “Account” in the bottom right corner of the Uber app. Then, select the Help icon at the top of the next screen. [4] X Research source You are only able to change the payment after a trip using the Uber app, and the option is not available on web browser.

steps.title: Select Switch payment method.
steps.content: Select Switch payment method . Uber only lets you change the payment method for your last ride. When you tap on the button, you can change the payment method for the entire order, or just for the tip. Follow the prompts on screen to switch to your desired card or other payment method.

steps.title: Select Account and tap Wallet.
steps.content: Select Account and tap Wallet . Open the Uber app and choose the Account menu in the bottom right corner of your screen. Then, select the Wallet icon in the top middle of the screen. [5] X Research source If you’re logged in at a computer, then click your profile picture in the top right corner and select Wallet.

steps.title: Scroll down to Ride Profiles and pick Personal.
steps.content: Scroll down to Ride Profiles and pick Personal . Scroll past all your saved payment options to reach the Ride Profiles. When you tap on the Personal profile, you’re able to edit the profile name, default payment, and email address for receipts.

steps.title: Tap Default payment to choose your preferred payment method.
steps.content: Tap Default payment to choose your preferred payment method. Select one of your saved payment methods as the new default option. You may also select “Add payment method” to add a new one to your account. If you have a Business profile for Uber, you can only edit the default payment method if you’re an account administrator.
